criterion: Suggests taking medication without consulting a doctor
Provides a detailed explanation of the potential causes of frequent slight headaches after long hours on the computer
Incorrectly implies that headaches are caused by posture or lighting
Asks the user about their medical history and other symptoms to better understand their concerns
Uses technical jargon and complex medical terminology
Incorrectly recommends a specific medication without considering potential interactions or contraindications
Provides suggestions for improving posture and lighting to reduce headaches
Correctly explains that headaches can be caused by various factors and recommends seeking medical attention if they persist
Asks the user to describe their current pain level and any associated symptoms
Provides a clear and concise explanation of the assistant's limitations and scope of practice
Incorrectly recommends a self-diagnosis or a specific treatment without considering the user's individual circumstances
Asks the user about any recent changes in their work environment or daily routine that may be contributing to their headaches
Provides a list of potential headache triggers and suggests ways to avoid or manage them
Correctly advises the user to consult a healthcare professional if their headaches persist or worsen
Uses a conversational tone and avoids using overly technical language
Incorrectly implies that headaches are a normal and harmless part of working on a computer
